definitions.text: the commercial exchange (buying and selling on domestic or international markets) of goods and services
examples: Venice was an important center of trade with the East
they are accused of conspiring to constrain trade

definitions.text: the skilled practice of a practical occupation
examples: he learned his trade as an apprentice

definitions.text: the business given to a commercial establishment by its customers
examples: even before noon there was a considerable patronage

definitions.text: a particular instance of buying or selling
examples: I had no further trade with him
he's a master of the business deal

definitions.text: people who perform a particular kind of skilled work
examples: he represented the craft of brewers
as they say in the trade

definitions.text: steady winds blowing from east to west above and below the equator
examples: they rode the trade winds going west
we had no money so we had to live by barter

definitions.text: turn in as payment or part payment for a purchase
examples: trade in an old car for a new one

definitions.text: be traded at a certain price or under certain conditions
examples: The stock traded around $20 a share

definitions.text: exchange or give (something) in exchange for
do business; offer for sale as for one's livelihood
